snippet: Mario Draghi, the European Central Bank president, reiterated that interest rates would be kept low for a while and offered a slightly upbeat outlook for the euro zone.
abstract: European Central Bank president Mario Draghi offers slightly more upbeat assessment of growth prospects, saying that euro zone has stabilized markedly in past year; bank will leave benchmark interest rate unchanged at record low 0.5 percent.

byline.contributor: Julia Werdigier contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Mario Draghi, the European Central Bank president, reiterated that interest rates would be kept low for a while and offered a slightly upbeat outlook for the euro zone.

headline.main: Central Bank Signals Slight Optimism for Europe, but Interest Rates Stay Low
headline.print_headline: Central Bank Signals Slight Optimism For Europe, but Interest Rates Stay Low
